formatted_address: 81 Choa Chu Kang Wy, Poolside, Singapore 688263
name: Italian Patio

reviews.text:
I recently had the pleasure of dining at Italian Patio, and I can honestly say it was one of the best dining experiences I've ever had! From the moment I walked in, I was enveloped by a warm and cozy ambiance that made me feel right at home. The setting beside the poolside, with the golf range in the background, created a serene atmosphere that was perfect for a relaxing evening.

The menu is a true delight, featuring a range of sumptuous Western cuisine that left me spoilt for choice.

What truly stood out was the impeccable service. The staff was not only attentive but genuinely friendly, making sure I had everything I needed throughout my meal. Their recommendations were spot-on, enhancing my dining experience even further.

Dined here with my family and the food quality was great! All the dishes we ordered were very tasty and atmosphere is great for chilling and chatting with friends/family. Would come back again, thanks!

A very special and cosy Italian food restaurant in Choa Chu Kang Area !! Itâ€™s not easy to get good Italian food in the west, Choa Chu Kang town !
There is pool side dining too. Free parking for visitors!!
A good spread on the menu. Must try the gelato ( ice cream ) after the mea.
The food was delicious and we enjoyed it.  Will come back to this place next time .
Came here after golf. The Italian food is simply amazing ðŸ¤© our guests loved it alot. Don't need to go to Italy for such great food. Generous with cheese!

Venue was decorated pleasantly and atmosphere was lively and perfect for families. Biggest turn off however was definitely the waiting time. While informed that there would be a 30minute waiting time, it took 45 minutes for two pizzas to arrive, and a total of 50 minutes for two slices of bruschetta to be served. Food was decent, nothing to rave about; to describe it simply, lasagna was slightly better than the frozen ones from NTUC, pasta dishes were perfect for those craving an after-meal coating of oil in the mouth. Would definitely recommend coming only during non-peak hours if you'd like to give this place a try. In somewhat fairness, the waitress did apologise for the one hour waiting time when handing us the bill. Nonetheless, wouldn't be recommending this place for a good while to others.
